comment.shortText:
Inexact interval in seconds between subsequent repeats of the background fetch alarm.
The final interval may differ from the specified one to minimize wakeups and battery usage.
comment.text:
On Android it defaults to **15 minutes**.

On iOS it calls `BackgroundFetch.setMinimumIntervalAsync` behind the scenes
and the default value is the smallest fetch interval supported by the
system (**10-15 minutes**).

comment.shortText: Whether to restart background fetch events when the device has finished booting. Defaults to `false`. (**Android only**)
Whether to stop receiving background fetch events after user terminates the app. Defaults to `true`. (**Android only**)
An attempt to download data was made but that attempt failed.
There was no new data to download.
Background updates are available for the app.
The user explicitly disabled background behavior for this app or for the whole system.

Background updates are unavailable and the user cannot enable them again.
This status can occur when, for example, parental controls are in effect for the current user.
Gets a status of background fetch.
comment.returns: A promise with the background fetch status enum, or `null` when unavailable.

comment.shortText: Registers background fetch task with given name. Registered tasks are saved in persistent storage and restored once the app is initialized.
comment.returns: Returns a promise that resolves once the task is registered and rejects in case of any errors.

comment.text: Name of the task to register. The task needs to be defined first - see `TaskManager.defineTask` for more details.

comment.shortText: Sets the minimum number of seconds that must elapse before another background fetch can be initiated. This value is advisory only and does not indicate the exact amount of time expected between fetch operations.
comment.text:
_This method doesn't take any effect on Android._

_It is a global value which means that it can overwrite settings from another application opened through Expo Go._
comment.returns: A promise resolving once the minimum interval is set.

comment.text: Number of seconds that must elapse before another background fetch can be called.

comment.shortText: Unregisters background fetch task, so the application will no longer be executing this task.
comment.returns: A promise resolving when the task is fully unregistered.

comment.text: Name of the task to unregister.
